Articles.Content:
As of today, it has been exactly one year since I made my purchase of KSP. At the time, it was version 0.21.1 and, looking back, I can see how much the game has changed in just a year. From career mode being implemented to a new space center design, to the ARM patch. I have enjoyed my time so far with KSP, stock and modded. Even now, I haven't done everything I can. I've done at least fly-by's of all the planets except Dres legitimately, and I still have to land on Moho, Eve, Gilly, Ike, Dres, Tylo, Vall, Bop, Pol and Eeloo. 10 objects out of 15, I haven't landed on legitimately.

But, overall, I'd like to give squad and the community a good ol' thank you for the game. It truly has been a great experience playing your game and seeing how others have been playing. Not to mention the challenges put forward to me on the forums. Thank you.

Hey, I have been playing for the exact same length of time!

It has been fun and the community is lovely. I cannot believe, that there can be so much good people in one community!
It was exactly one year since I joined the KSP forums - coincidence? I think not
The two posts above this show how great the community is
All of you talking about how great the community is. It just means you haven't met me yet. =)) =))

It's coming up on two years since I first found out about KSP, and yet I still consider myself a newcomer to the game! I remember the old days of 0.18 very fondly. I didn't make a forum account until the Great Forum Apocalypse of April 2013, but I've never regretted it (holy cow, how do I have over a thousand posts?!?). This community is the best!
